Blue-chip McDonald's, Advanced Micro Devices, and Super Micro Computer were among earnings movers in the stock market today.

headline: How major US stock indexes fared Wednesday, 8/6/2025
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average added 0.2%, and the Nasdaq composite rose 1.2%. Apple alone accounted for more than a third of the S&P 500's gain ahead of an announcement at the White House where it's expected to increase its U.S. investments by an additional $100 billion over the next four years. Trading elsewhere on Wall Street was mixed following a jumble of profit reports.

headline: Staples and Discretionary Stocks Are Soaring Together. That's Not Supposed to Happen.
summary: Staples and discretionary are often viewed by traders as opposites, so they don't often rally together.  The S&P's discretionary sector was up 2.3%, while staples were up 1.9%.  It happened two times in 2024 and three times in 2023, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: McDonald's global sales top estimates as promotions boost demand
summary: STORY: McDonald's on Wednesday reported second-quarter earnings and revenue that beat Wall Street estimates, lifting shares as much as three and a half percent in morning trading.The fast-food giant benefitted from promotions and its affordable meal bundles that drew budget-conscious customers looking to stretch their dollar amid economic uncertainty.Competition among fast-food restaurants has intensified as McDonald's and rivals Domino's Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands double down on value meals to counter a slowdown in customer demand.McDonald's in April launched a limited-time Happy Meal offer tied to the "Minecraft" movie, followed in May by the rollout of McCrispy Chicken Strips as a permanent menu item.Menu innovation and promotions also helped Domino's report upbeat U.S. same-store sales, while weakening demand hurt sales at Yum Brands and Chipotle.McDonald's said re-engaging the low-income consumer is "critical," as they provide the bulk of the chain's foot traffic.But the company's CEO added that executives at McDonald's "remain cautious about the overall near-term health of the U.S. consumer."

raw.headline: McDonald's global sales top estimates as promotions boost demand
raw.summary: STORY: McDonald's on Wednesday reported second-quarter earnings and revenue that beat Wall Street estimates, lifting shares as much as three and a half percent in morning trading.The fast-food giant benefitted from promotions and its affordable meal bundles that drew budget-conscious customers looking to stretch their dollar amid economic uncertainty.Competition among fast-food restaurants has intensified as McDonald's and rivals Domino's Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands double down on value meals to counter a slowdown in customer demand.McDonald's in April launched a limited-time Happy Meal offer tied to the "Minecraft" movie, followed in May by the rollout of McCrispy Chicken Strips as a permanent menu item.Menu innovation and promotions also helped Domino's report upbeat U.S. same-store sales, while weakening demand hurt sales at Yum Brands and Chipotle.McDonald's said re-engaging the low-income consumer is "critical," as they provide the bulk of the chain's foot traffic.But the company's CEO added that executives at McDonald's "remain cautious about the overall near-term health of the U.S. consumer."

headline: Apple $100B commitment, McDonald's weakness, Super Micro sinks
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks Wednesday's top market movers and stocks in this Market Minute. Apple (AAPL) will announce an additional $100 billion commitment to the US alongside President Trump, adding to its previous $500 billion pledge. McDonald's (MCD) says economic stress is weighing on breakfast sales, with the CEO promising more value-focused options ahead. Super Micro Computer (SMCI) stock sinks after the company cut its full-year revenue outlook, raising concerns over artificial intelligence (AI) server demand and pricing pressure. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: McDonald's sees US rebound but says low-income diners remain stressed
summary: McDonald's profits rose in the second quarter behind a rebound in US sales but executives said Wednesday that low-income consumers remained under economic stress.McDonald's Chief Executive Christopher Kempczinski described the US consumer base as "bifurcated," with weakness in low-income consumers a reason for lingering caution on the outlook, he said at the outset of an earnings conference call.

headline: McDonald's Defies Industry Downturn With Strong Sales, But China Challenges Persist
summary: McDonald’s Corporation (NYSE:MCD) shares are trading higher on Wednesday. The company reported second-quarter adjusted earnings per share of $3.19, beating the analyst consensus estimate of $3.14. Quarterly sales of $6.843 billion outpaced the Street view of $6.682 billion. Global comparable sales rose 3.8%, driven by a 2.5% increase in the U.S., a 4% gain in International Operated Markets (IOM), and a 5.6% uptick in International Developmental Licensed Markets. Also Read: Yum! Brands Opens 871

headline: McDonald’s Stock Rises After Earnings Beat. What It Says About New Menu Items, Price Hikes.
summary: McDonald’  s stock rose after it posted quarterly results that topped Wall Street’s expectations early Wednesday.  Investors were closely watching whether McDonald’s new menu items and promotional deals could put it back on the growth track.  Second-quarter adjusted earnings per share (EPS) came in at $3.19 on revenue of $6.8 billion, beating analysts’ expectations of adjusted EPS of $3.14 on revenue of $6.7 billion, according to FactSet.

headline: McDonald's posts better-than-expected sales as chicken strips, Minecraft meal drive traffic
summary: Hot products like a “Minecraft”-themed meal helped McDonald’s turn around its sagging sales in the second quarter.  The Chicago burger giant said Wednesday its revenue rose 5% to $6.8 billion in the April-June period.  McDonald's shares rose 3% in premarket trading Wednesday.

raw.headline: McDonald's posts better-than-expected sales as chicken strips, Minecraft meal drive traffic
raw.summary: Hot products like a “Minecraft”-themed meal helped McDonald’s turn around its sagging sales in the second quarter.  The Chicago burger giant said Wednesday its revenue rose 5% to $6.8 billion in the April-June period.  McDonald's shares rose 3% in premarket trading Wednesday.

headline: McDonald's global sales top estimates as affordable meal options boost demand
summary: (Reuters) -McDonald's global comparable sales beat Wall Street expectations for second quarter, as affordable meal bundles and promotions drew in budget-conscious diners looking to stretch their dollars amid persistent economic uncertainty.  Strong demand in the U.S. and international markets powered a 3.8% rise in global same-store sales, above expectations of a 2.4% rise, according to data compiled by LSEG.  Fast-food chains have seen competition heat up as companies such as McDonald's, Domino's Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands double down on value meals to counter a slowdown in demand, mainly among the lower-income households.

raw.headline: McDonald's global sales top estimates as affordable meal options boost demand
raw.summary: (Reuters) -McDonald's global comparable sales beat Wall Street expectations for second quarter, as affordable meal bundles and promotions drew in budget-conscious diners looking to stretch their dollars amid persistent economic uncertainty.  Strong demand in the U.S. and international markets powered a 3.8% rise in global same-store sales, above expectations of a 2.4% rise, according to data compiled by LSEG.  Fast-food chains have seen competition heat up as companies such as McDonald's, Domino's Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands double down on value meals to counter a slowdown in demand, mainly among the lower-income households.

headline: S&P Futures Gain With Focus on Earnings and Fed Speak
summary: September S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESU25) are trending up +0.24% this morning as investors digested U.S. President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threats and weak economic data, with the focus now shifting to a fresh batch of corporate earnings reports and remarks from Federal Reserve officials.

headline: Disney Earnings, New Tariff Deadline, Fed Speakers: Still to Come This Week
summary: Earnings season marches on, with results from Eli Lilly, Walt Disney and McDonald’s among this week's highlights, along with President Trump's new tariff-hike deadline for many countries. Trump also said he would name replacements this week for Federal Reserve governor Adriana Kugler and Bureau of Labor Statistics chief Erika McEntarfer.
